Text.Value: I - I refuse. There has to be a better way -

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous defiance

Text.Value: K'chakhi! We are training to fight ghaik. You think they will hesitate?

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] The teacher beats a cowering student with a blunt object
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The teacher beats a cowering student hard in the stomach with a blunt object. Other students watch this, unflinching. The teacher does not acknowledge the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Angry, has been beating him, posturing for the class

Text.Value: An interesting proposition.
Try to stop yourself. Attack without killing him.
Make a non-fatal attack.
Yes, a demonstration may be just what's needed.
End him! Shred him with a daggered dance!
I suppose your inane spewings have distracted enough from my lesson.
There's no honour in killing a defenceless boy.
*The boy appears considerably less... alive than you were anticipating.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player scratches their head/looks embarassed.

Text.Value: This is no concern of yours. I'm simply demonstrating what happens when we fail to follow orders.
Stay out of this, istik. They need to learn what happens when they fail to follow orders.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The teacher stops beating the boy, and whips around towards the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive of player's interruption, with a malicious smile

Text.Value: But as we seem so intent on doing things differently today, why not?

EditorData.NodeContext: Coming around to the idea after first dismissing it outright

Text.Value: Stand back and relish the blood-show.
Watch what happens.
Another who lacks the nerve? It seems Varrl's idiocy is contagious.
Silence! It seems your childish prattling is attracting an audience.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The teacher finally acknowledges the player
EditorData.NodeContext: Teacher finally acnowledges the player

Text.Value: You dropped your guard on your weak side and were completely open to an off-hand counter.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The student stabs Varrl with a dagger, killing him.
EditorData.NodeContext: Impossible to please

Text.Value: One bad egg does not reflect the true power of Crèche Y'llek.
Try to stop yourself. Attack without killing him.
Move him out of the way. We've wasted enough time already.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sharp, addressing students

Text.Value: I'd bring him to the edge of death. Leave him asking why he deserves to live.
I hope you do not prove this weak should we share a battlefield, ra'stil.

EditorData.NodeContext: sarcastic

Text.Value: I - I refuse. There has to be a better way -

EditorData.NodeContext: Nervous defiance

Text.Value: Make a non-fatal attack.
Leave.
*You skilfully avoid hitting any major organs, but apparently it was enough. He's out cold.*
Well look at you, killer. I didn't know you had it in you.

EditorData.NodeContext: Coyly, amused. Just watched the player accidentally kill a young gith in combat.

Text.Value: Who wants to challenge this snivelling is'tark?

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing the room

Text.Value: What are you waiting for? Begin!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] The student advances a bit toward the player, dagger ready but shaking in his hand, then decides he can't do it and drops the dagger
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The boy advances, his dagger shaking but ready. Then, he drops it...
EditorData.SFXTags: Metal knife drop on floor SFX

Text.Value: K'chakhi! Why do you keep hesitating? My instructions were clear!

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] *DUPE* The teacher beats a cowering student
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The teacher beats a cowering student hard in the stomach with a blunt object. Other students watch this, unflinching. The teacher does not acknowledge the player.
EditorData.NodeContext: Angry, has been beating him, posturing for the class

Text.Value: Because - because they don't make sense! Killing each other like this, it's stupid! Orph-

EditorData.NodeContext: dizzy, scared but defiant; Boy intends to say "Orpheus says..."

Text.Value: Go whet the swords. I want them sharp enough to peel a ghaik's eyeball just by looking at them.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] The teacher hits the student one last time, hard, the student falls to the ground
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The teacher hits Varrl a final time, harder than any of the previous, knocking him to the ground.
EditorData.SFXTags: One big whack SFX from being hit

Text.Value: Yes, let's see how Varrl fares against the skills of a lesser crèche.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] The teacher goes up to the student, dagger in hand and makes a show of murdering the student in violent fashion with his superior knife skill. The student falls onto the floor, dead.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The teacher emotionlessly runs Varrl through with his dagger. Varrl screams and falls dead to the floor.
EditorData.NodeContext: Actor note: The student will turn their torso to look back at the teacher right before the teacher slices their neck.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] The player bends down and picks up a dagger from the floor
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player picks up a dagger (can be from floor, rack - cinematic preference)

Text.Value: Pathetic. He deserves a pathetic death.
The boy's naivety is pathetic. Kill him.
Seems a little murderous to me. I'll pass.
If he won't fight, he's useless. Kill him yourself and be done with this.
This is how we deal with a weakened enemy -
They won't need to, if we keep killing each other for them! It's - it's stupid! Orph-

EditorData.NodeContext: Dizzy, scared but defiant; Boy intends to say "Orpheus says..."

Text.Value: Why didn't you make the kill? My instructions were clear!

EditorData.NodeContext: Irritated

Text.Value: And yet here you are, pathetically pleading for the same useless mercy.

EditorData.NodeContext: Irritated

Text.Value: Leave the boy alone. You made your point.
A true warrior's kill: quick, bloody, and a scream to curdle the stomach juices of Vlaakith herself.

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing students, smug

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player stabs Varrl, revelling in his agonised screams as they twist the knife. He falls to the floor, dead.
EditorData.NodeContext: Actor note: after pulling the knife from the student, stand for a bit looking down at the student's corpse before walking back,
EditorData.SFXTags: Metal in to body SFX, Pain cries from student SFX

EditorData.AnimationTags: [KAYLEIGH] The player steps forward and stabs the student with the dagger in the abdomen. The student screams and falls to the floor.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player stabs Varrl with the dagger. He screams and falls to the floor.
EditorData.NodeContext: Actor note: after pulling the knife from the student, stand for a bit looking down at the student's corpse before walking back,
EditorData.SFXTags: Knife in to body SFX, Cries of pain VFX, Small blood splatter

Text.Value: By the good gods, such cruelty. Is your soul truly this sick?
No. This is too far. He's learnt his lesson!
Lesser? A Crèche K'liir hatchling would not have dared defy an elder.
I've been practicing every night, Sa'varsh. Let me have a go.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Student 2 steps forward, drawing her dagger.

Text.Value: Cowards are not tolerated in our ranks. Though I gather they are welcome in yours.
I hope you prove as weak as this should we meet on the battlefield, istik.
G'lyck. Kill him, and put us all out of our misery.

EditorData.NodeContext: Teacher at the end of their rope

Text.Value: Take a dagger, stranger. This exercise requires nothing more than a blade, and a backbone.
Killing your own soldiers is an odd strategy for winning a war.
You fight again. This time, daggers only. And to the death as instructed.

EditorData.NodeContext: Commanding, to Varrl

Text.Value: Offer to fight the boy yourself.
Yet another staggering display of incompetence.

EditorData.NodeContext: With a sigh, disappointed player failed to kill Varrl

Text.Value: You? Tsk'va. My students do not waste their time fighting such weaklings.

EditorData.NodeContext: Dismissive

Synopsis: The teacher puts the hurt boy in a deadly fight against another student. You can interfere and save the boy, kill him, or watch the events unfold.
